definition: half (of sth)/halfway through
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length
upper jacket
felt a chill (in one's heart)/(one's heart) sank
to be inferior to/to be of a lower grade than

sentences.english: When he knew that she had been going out with several other men, it cooled his ardor.
sentences.chinese: 當他知道她曾與好幾個男人出去時，他的心涼了半截。

sentences.english: The idea of going to school left him cold.
sentences.chinese: 想到要去上學他的心就涼了半截。
他把工作只幹了半截兒。

sentences.english: In 1527, he lost the lower half of his left arm in a riot.
sentences.chinese: 1527年，他在一場騷亂中失去了下半截左臂。

sentences.english: He left half his work until the next day .
sentences.chinese: 他把工作只幹了半截兒。

sentences.english: Suddenly he looked down and spotted a high-heeled shoe half hidden under the passenger seat.
sentences.chinese: 突然，他低頭瞥見在客座下露出半截高跟鞋。

sentences.english: Please cut those air pipes carefully and keep the top boss safely.
sentences.chinese: 切除時請小心別傷到通風管的上半截。

sentences.english: Open head phrase is to be, how Xing picked up half and driven away?
sentences.chinese: 開腔的頭一句就是要盡人事，咋興撈起半截就開跑呢？

sentences.english: Just be sure not to prattle on.
sentences.chinese: 就是別讓自己把話說半截。

sentences.english: The stump of Tyrion's nose was itching fiercely. He gave it a scratch.
sentences.chinese: 提利昂的半截鼻子奇癢無比，他抓了抓它。

sentences.english: When talking, he hiccupped and lit a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 說到半截他停了下來，點上一支菸又說起來。

sentences.english: All the police had to go on was a half-burnt Christmas card.
sentences.chinese: 警察所持有的全部根據是一張燒成半截的聖誕賀卡。

sentences.english: He scrunched up the half written letter and threw it away.
sentences.chinese: 他把寫了半截的書信團攏後扔了。

definition: half of sth/one side of sth
at the base/at the root/(of a leg) just below the crutch
to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length
to insert/to stick in/to plug in (an electronic device)
to snap sth off/to break
with a crash/with a thunderous noise
bald/bare
(hitting) squarely in the middle/(slicing) across the middle/to hold by the waist
to pick up
to chop off
body/pregnancy/health
midair
wooden stick
to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
suddenly
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
